Since all contracts are for the same type (put or call), we can do this for both contracts and take the minimum value to determine the number of shares to buy or sell.

$150,000 (cash balance) + $2,630 (equity value of one share) = $150,263

To sell 1 share, we need to have equity of at least $150 * 100 shares. This gives us:

$2,630 (equity value of one share) = $0
